inscription:
Recto: Above the painting, is inscribed a couplet from a ghazal of Hafiz:
‘I drew the image of your face on the workshop of my eye, I saw nor heard no idol in your form.’
Below the painting is a couplet from an unidentified Persian poem: ‘From this Hindu boy it became clear to me That there is a fire in this Indian soil …’

Verso: ‘amal-i Hunhar (‘the work of Hunhar’), seal impression of Bayram Khan Husayni
medium: Opaque pigments and gold laid down on card
text: A portrait of a person in profile from the torso up, facing the left side of the page. The person is depicted wearing light-colored clothing with floral details, strands of beads, and white pearl earrings. They wear a turban of coral and green, and have their right hand raised. The portrait is painted against a background of turquoise green. Above and below the portrait are lines of text. The portrait is within a frame of green and pink floral designs, and the rest of the page is embellished with a floral pattern.
title: Bust portrait of an idealized youth
